meanings.definition: Burstiest: superlative form of burst, characterized by sudden release or outburst
meanings.sent1: The fireworks display was the burstiest event of the year, with colorful explosions lighting up the sky.
meanings.sent2: The storm brought the burstiest rainfall we had seen in months, causing flooding in many areas.
meanings.sent3: The burstiest surprise at the party was when the cake suddenly exploded with confetti and streamers.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like the burstiest of bubbles, infectious and uncontrollable.
meanings.sent5: The burstiest moment in the movie was when the hero finally defeated the villain in a spectacular showdown.

meanings.definition: Burstiest: having the most bursts or sudden increases in activity or intensity
meanings.sent1: The burstiest part of the race was the final sprint to the finish line, with runners giving it their all.
meanings.sent2: During the burstiest moments of the concert, the crowd cheered and clapped with excitement.
meanings.sent3: The burstiest traffic jam occurred when all the cars tried to merge into one lane at the same time.
meanings.sent4: Her energy was like the burstiest of suns, radiating warmth and brightness to everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The burstiest memory from the trip was when they stumbled upon a hidden waterfall in the forest.
